Definition: In Angular, an NgModule allows you to bundle components, directives, pipes, and providers together into one re-usable module.
intro: Components, directives, pipes are declared once and only once in an NgModule. The same component/direcive/pipe cannot be declared in multiple modules. NgModules/component/directives/pipes can be exported by your module. But only other NgModules can be imported into your module.
example: shared-person.module is a ngModule which has UpdatePrivateComponent & UpdatePersonComponent components.
It has input and out directives.
When enter a new name it will update array and display in the list.
